entry.title: Claude Code Plugins & Marketplaces
entry.summary: Explains Claude Code plugin architecture: commands, skills, and agents packaged into plugins and marketplaces. Covers component discovery, manifest structure, installation workflows, and marketplace distribution. Demonstrates developer experience considerations for reusable AI tooling.

entry.title: There's an agent in my errors
entry.summary: Demonstrates agentic behaviour within programmatic workflows using Claude Code slash commands and FireCrawl. Shows input validation, structured output design for agent interpretation, self-healing patterns, guardrailing agent suggestions, and documentation curation automation.

entry.title: Claude Code in Data Analysis Action
entry.summary: Visual walkthrough of using Claude Code for data analysis and debugging. Demonstrates agentic investigation through hypothesis formation, self-directed code analysis, root cause identification, and iterative problem-solving leading to automated fix implementation in a Python data visualisation project.

entry.title: YouTube Transcript to XML • Step 1 of 3
entry.summary: Python CLI tool converting YouTube transcripts to structured XML with automatic chapter detection. Built entirely with Claude Code using test-driven development (60% test coverage), deliberate XML schema design, and clean architecture for future API integration. Uses yt-dlp for transcript extraction.

entry.title: Personal Tutor Follow Along: Claude Code and Python
entry.summary: Beginner tutorial demonstrating interactive learning with AI: using claude.ai as personal coach to set up VSCode, Git, UV, and Claude Code on Mac. Six replicable conversations covering Python project setup, Jupyter notebooks, pre-commit hooks, and Git workflows.

entry.title: Into Claude Code from Replit and Loveable
entry.summary: Beginner guide for v0 and Replit users transitioning to Claude Code. Covers IDE setup, CLAUDE.md configuration and iteration, plan mode workflows, PRD documentation practices, GitHub CLI integration, and MCP introduction.

entry.title: Swim Club Website with AI Tools
entry.summary: AI-assisted website design project demonstrating user research (stakeholder discovery in Miro), multi-tool AI workflows (Relume for sitemap/wireframes, Midjourney for custom hexagonal imagery, Claude for WordPress, ElevenLabs for dubbing), and change management (staff training and adoption). Shows prompt engineering for visual style consistency.

entry.title: Put Aside the Bench for the Mark: Choosing an LLM
entry.summary: Python notebook comparing five Anthropic models on speed, capability, and cost. Demonstrates use-case-specific LLM evaluation methodology, speed-capability-cost tradeoff analysis, statistical analysis of API responses, cost optimisation considerations, and future-proofing strategies for model selection.

entry.title: Correct Large Documents with Anthropic API
entry.summary: Python notebook using Anthropic API to correct writing errors in large Word documents (100k+ words). Demonstrates chunking strategies for large document processing, automated prompt evaluation, LLM output validation through semantic similarity testing, and multi-language support (English, German, Italian).

entry.title: Lessons Learnt on AI Coding a Tiny Python Function
entry.summary: Explores prompt engineering lessons from AI-assisted Python coding with Claude Sonnet. Demonstrates test-driven iteration, prompt refinement through feedback loops, and the critical insight of balancing constraints versus AI autonomy—being too declarative reduces AI creativity and slows development.

entry.title: AI Bingo Words For the Silently Confused
entry.summary: AI terminology hierarchy explained for non-technical readers: Data Science, ML, Deep Learning, Foundation Models, RAG, AI Agents. Demonstrates business value assessment by comparing ML vs Gen AI through real products built: industrial safety systems, computer vision, content recommendation (ML); document processing, LLM API integration (Gen AI).
